subsection_content: Colonic diverticula usually do not cause symptoms and are often discovered during a colonoscopy. The disease can also be diagnosed with an abdominopelvic CT scan or contrast-enhanced colon X-ray. During an episode of acute diverticulitis, a CT scan may be used to diagnose the extent of the infection.
